Agreed.Title: Using specialist business databases
Agreed.Description: Guides written to help students and researchers to make effective and accurate use of the specialist financial and business databases available at The University of Manchester. The guides are organised by database, including Bloomberg and Datastream.

Agreed.Title: Business Data Service: Virtual Consultation (beta)
Agreed.Description: Search some of our previous research consultation enquiries and detailed answers. They cover a selection of financial, economic and business data sources.

Agreed.Title: Copyright for teaching materials: can I use it?
Agreed.Description: This short online resource will help you to determine whether you can use specific types of material in your teaching, without breaching copyright.

Agreed.Title: Copyright for student: Who owns what?
Agreed.Description: This resource provides a basic introduction to copyright, whilst looking how it can affect you as a student.

Agreed.Title: Adding up: describing data and choosing a statistical test
Agreed.Description: This resource will explore the methods and descriptives you can use to describe your data. It will also show you how to select appropriate statistical tests and find them in SPSS.

Agreed.Title: Adding up: introducing SPSS
Agreed.Description: This resource explores some of the key features and interfaces of SPSS, which you can use to generate reports, charts, descriptive statistics and analysis.

Agreed.Title: Adding up: introduction to statistics
Agreed.Description: This resource will give you a basic introduction to statistical terminology, charts and data types. It will also give you advice on how to organise your data to make it easier to analyse and present.

Agreed.Title: Getting started with EndNote desktop
Agreed.Description: This resource explores some of the key features of EndNote desktop  reference management software. It includes video demonstrations in how to collect, organise and format your references.

Agreed.Title: Getting started with EndNote online
Agreed.Description: This resource explores some of the key features of EndNote online  reference management software. It includes video demonstrations in how to collect, organise and format your references.

Agreed.Title: EndNote desktop
Agreed.Description: This video playlist will take you through the essential steps to using EndNote desktop software for managing your references.

Agreed.Title: EndNote online
Agreed.Description: This video playlist will take you through the essential steps to using EndNote online software for managing your references.

Agreed.Title: Specialist Library Support YouTube channel
Agreed.Description:
Welcome to the University of Manchester Library's Specialist Learning Support YouTube channel for students and staff. This resource is here to help you develop your skills across areas that include:

•  Referencing
•  Advanced searching and systematic review
•  Business data and statistics.

These videos will help you get started!

Agreed.Title: Copyright Guidance at The University of Manchester
Agreed.Description: This guide will help you to find out how copyright affects your work, research and study here at the University of Manchester.

Agreed.Title: Start to finish: Statistics
Agreed.Description: This guide can help you to analyse a data set and produce a range of statistics. It includes three key areas: a basic introduction to statistics, describing data choosing a statisticial test and an introduction to producing reports in SPSS.

Agreed.Title: Referencing guide at the University of Manchester
Agreed.Description: This guide explores the basics of referencing including key referencing styles used at Manchester and popular referencing software such as Endnote, Mendeley and Zotero.

Agreed.Title: Data & Statistics guide at the University of Manchester
Agreed.Description:
This guide provides information for University of Manchester students and staff on how to understand and use data effectively, support for statistical support and statistis resources for the UK, EU and International regions.
You will find these resources useful for locating statistics in books, journal articles, databases and on the web.

Agreed.Title: Trade and Industry news: an introduction
Trade & industry news: finding specific publications
Making use of MeSH and Suggested Subject Terms
Understanding your data
Agreed.Description: In this post you will learn about data types and best practices for structuring your data.
